title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For checking off a distance-measuring device and describing its use in part (b)

1 point is earned: For checking off a stopwatch and describing its use in part (b)
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned: For checking off a distance-measuring device and describing its use in part (b)

1 point is earned: For checking off a stopwatch and describing its use in part (b)

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Use the tape measure and chalk to mark off the 100 meters in 10 meter lengths. Set a classmate with a stopwatch at marks as shown. Use the starter’s pistol to signal the runner to run and the classmates to start their stopwatches. Each person turns off the stopwatch when the runner reaches his or her mark. You then have measurements of the time to reach each increment of 10 meters.

1 point is earned: For taking distance measurements for 8 to 11 distinct fixed positions per run

1 point is earned: For measuring time for the same 8 to 11 distinct fixed positions, consistent with the description of the experimental setup

2 points are earned: For an experimental technique consistent with being able to determine the requested quantities

1 point is earned: For a diagram of the experimental setup with clear labels and consistent with the technique described (awarded even if the technique is wrong)

1 point is earned: For a technique that allows data for all positions to be taken in a single run

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Approach A

3 points are earned: For a clear and detailed explanation of the data analysis process

Note: This part of the solution was graded holistically and students could earn between 0 and 3 points depending on the clarity and completeness of their explanation

1 point is earned: For equations or clear prose and use of the data to identify the two distinct regions of motion (constant acceleration and constant velocity)

1 point is earned: For clearly and correctly identifying tu

1 point is earned: For clearly and correctly identifying au

1 point is earned: For having the final answers correct and no incorrect statements or calculations among the correct ones

Approach B

Students needed to clearly indicate which variable was used (acceleration or final velocity) by including the following.

1 point is earned: For a description or diagram that clearly defines all the variables being used

1 point is earned: For a description or diagram showing how the needed variable (acceleration or final velocity) will be determined

2 points are earned: For a successful transformation of the above description into equation form

1 point is earned: For correctly solving the equations obtained

1 point is earned: For work that would determine a correct value of au

1 point is earned: For work that would determine a correct value of tu
